sourceOrganization.name: NIAID TCRR-SAD Program
sourceOrganization.abstract: T Cell Reagent Research for the Study of Allergic Diseases (TCRR-SAD) advances the identification, characterization, and validation of novel T-cell epitopes in food allergens and aeroallergens. This research enhances understanding of allergic disease mechanisms and informs therapeutic development.
sourceOrganization.description: T Cell Reagent Research for the Study of Allergic Diseases (TCRR-SAD) supports novel T-cell epitope identification, characterization and validation of important food allergens and aeroallergens that have not been previously studied. For more information, visit the NIAID program page: https://www.niaid.nih.gov/research/t-cell-reagent-research-study-allergic-diseases
alternateName: T Cell Reagent Research for the Study of Allergic Diseases
